poem:
**Recognition**

The pages whispered  
Across time's silent expanse,  
Ghosts of cities rising  
In the Australian sun.  
His voice, a vessel filled  
With words that trembled,  
Echoed by hands and legs  
Gone numb. He stood,  
An atlas of emotion,  
Tear-stricken,  
At the threshold  
Of literature's embrace.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Siang Lu wins Miles Franklin award for Ghost Cities, ‘a genuine landmark in Australian literature’ When Siang Lu found out he’d won the Miles Franklin literary award, he had a physical reaction. “I was in such shock that I lost all feeling in my hands and legs,” the Brisbane-based author says. “I teared up. I lost my voice a little bit. It was the first time in my life that I’ve ever had to ask". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
